My Apologies, I should have put one in before ...

In the example below, I have shown a method named,
initLocation, you will see this method checks the
state of the MBean before the method proceeds to do
its stuff..

Please note that this 'StateString' is set by JBoss.

public synchronized String initLocation () {
    	
    	/* Check if the StateString has "Started" value.
*/
    	if (!this.getStateString().equals("Started")) 
    		return "Service currently not started ";
    	try {
        	popLocals();
            this.running = true;
    	} catch (Exception e) {
            this.running = false;
    		log.error("Error invoking popLocals");
    	}
}

From your reply I get the feeling, I might have to end
up using cactus, as this 'StateString' is something
which is set by JBoss.

Regards,
Ravi

--- Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:

> Hi Ravi,
> 
> On 10/25/06, Ravi <mravi_in@...> wrote:
> >  MBeans in Jboss have a field called State which
> Jboss
> >  sets to started using the ServiceCOntroller
> MBean. If
> >  methods in the MBean are dependent on this field.
> Is
> >  there any way to actually set the field without
> >  actualy integrating it with the container? or
> would
> >  testing this method constitue a "Junit
> Integration"
> >  test?
> 
> Without knowing that much of JMX, if there is a way
> for your unit test
> to set the State in the MBean under test then I'd
> quite likely opt for
> that approach. Do you have an example of an MBean
> that "depends" on
> the state field? Maybe seeing an actual example of
> the dependency
> would help us non-JMX savvy folks on the list
> understand your
> situation better.
> 
> Lasse
>
